advertiser_name: How to become a LVN in San Diego.
ad_text: How to become a LVN in San Diego. Sponsored We offer partial or fulltime train to become an important member of the health care team—and to qualify to pursue roles in a variety of health care settings. Licensed vocational nurses (LVNs) provide basic care to patients under the supervision of registered nurses (RNs) and physicians. As an LVN, you could do everything from help to feed new babies, change bandages in acute care, keep chemotherapy patients comfortable during treatment, or help older patients dress. You’ll also update patient charts and communicate important information to the rest of the health care team. Call Dr. Sergio Conti at 619-719-3488 to get more information. Our FT classes will start on February 6, 2023 Hurry up, don't loose this wonderful opportunity to change your life. FB.COM How to become a LVN in San Diego.
